intro: Sicyos chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí bottle gourd, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a climbing vine that produces large, inflated, bottle-shaped fruits. The plant is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. Its leaves are broad and lobed, while its flowers are typically yellow with five petals. The fruit is used in traditional medicine and as a container due to its unique shape and durability.
